p: Fig. 4 B shows the same additional air pollution deaths due to climate change by region, but shows the causes of death. Of the additional 12,100 (95% CI: 10,300 to 13,800) PM 2.5-related deaths, 42% are related to stroke and the rest are related to ischemic heart disease (IHD), chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD), and lung cancer. Additional ozone-related mortality due to respiratory problems is estimated to be 8,900 (95% CI: 2,300 to 4,700) people per year.
